justification: Analyzed package stability I=1.0 (Ce=3, Ca=0). Outgoing dependencies: com.google.gson.reflect I=0.1 (Ce=1, Ca=9), com.google.gson I=0.294 (Ce=5, Ca=12), com.google.gson.stream I=0.2 (Ce=2, Ca=8). All dependencies have lower instability (more stable) than the analyzed package.
The package has an instability (I) of 0 (Ce=0, Ca=1), indicating high stability. It has zero outgoing dependencies, meaning it does not depend on any less stable components.
Package has no outgoing dependencies (Ce=0) and no incoming dependencies (Ca=0). There are no dependencies to violate the Stable Dependencies Principle.
Analyzed package stability (Ca/(Ca+Ce)=0.25) is less than all outgoing dependencies: com.google.gson.reflect (0.9), com.google.gson (0.71), com.google.gson.stream (0.8).

The analyzed package has stability S=1.0 (Ca=0, Ce=4). Its outgoing dependencies have stabilities: com.google.gson.reflect (S=0.1, Ca=9, Ce=1), com.google.gson (S≈0.294, Ca=12, Ce=5), com.google.gson.stream (S=0.2, Ca=8, Ce=2), com.google.gson.internal (S≈0.455, Ca=6, Ce=5). All dependencies are more stable (lower S) than the analyzed package.

The analyzed package has instability I=1.0 (Ce=2, Ca=0) and depends on packages with lower instability: com.google.gson.reflect (I=0.1, Ce=1, Ca=9) and com.google.gson (I≈0.294, Ce=5, Ca=12). Since all dependencies point to more stable packages, the Stable Dependencies Principle is satisfied.

The package has instability (I) of 0.75 and depends on 'com.google.gson.internal.reflect' with instability 0.5 and 'com.google.gson.internal' with instability 0.4545, which are both less stable than the package itself (I_dep < I_package).

The analyzed package has instability index 1.0 (Ce=3, Ca=0). All its outgoing dependencies have lower instability indices: com.google.gson.stream (0.2), com.google.gson (~0.294), and com.google.gson.reflect (0.1). Since all dependencies are more stable (lower instability index) than the analyzed package, the Stable Dependencies Principle is not violated.

The analyzed package (stability I=1.0) depends only on 'com.google.gson' (stability I≈0.294). The dependency is more stable (lower I value) than the analyzed package, thus no violation of the Stable Dependencies Principle.

The package's instability (I = Ce/(Ca+Ce) = 2/(8+2) = 0.2) is lower than the instability of its outgoing dependencies: com.google.gson (I = 5/(12+5) ≈ 0.29) and com.google.gson.internal (I = 5/(6+5) ≈ 0.45). This means the package is more stable than the packages it depends on, which follows the Stable Dependencies Principle.

Package stability (Ce=5, Ca=12, S=0.294) is lower than dependencies: com.google.gson.stream (Ce=2, Ca=8, S=0.2) and com.google.gson.reflect (Ce=1, Ca=9, S=0.1). This violates the Stable Dependencies Principle.

The package has instability I=1.0. Its outgoing dependencies have lower instability values (com.google.gson.reflect I=0.1, com.google.gson I≈0.294, com.google.gson.stream I=0.2). Since all dependencies are more stable (lower I) than the package, the Stable Dependencies Principle is satisfied.

The analyzed package has stability 0.5 (Ce=2, Ca=2). Its outgoing dependencies are com.google.gson (stability 0.706, Ce=5, Ca=12) and com.google.gson.internal (stability 0.545, Ce=5, Ca=6). All outgoing dependencies have higher stability values than the analyzed package.

Analyzed package has Ca=0, Ce=1, instability I=1.0. Outgoing dependency com.google.gson has Ca=12, Ce=5, instability I=0.29. The dependency is more stable (0.29 < 1.0), adhering to the Stable Dependencies Principle.

The package depends on less stable packages 'com.google.gson.internal.bind' (stability 0.75) and 'com.google.gson.internal.reflect' (stability 0.50), which have higher instability values than its own instability of 0.45, violating the Stable Dependencies Principle.

The analyzed package has stability S=0.9 (Ca=9, Ce=1). Its outgoing dependency com.google.gson.internal has stability S=0.545 (Ca=6, Ce=5). Since the analyzed package is more stable than its dependency, it violates the Stable Dependencies Principle.
